text: one of the things that gets missed in
the discussion about AWS is how powerful
it can make a handful of people so we
are a very small office the technical
team is basically me and one other guy
and we are able to manage an online
community of half a million
people and that is entirely due to
AWS my name is David Beck I'm the
technical director of of nanor rim. org
which is also called National novel
writing month and my role with the
organization is managing all things
technical we host a community of writers
um there are about 500,000 active
writers within our community and every
November they come together to write
novels together last year we had about
450,000 participants during November and
48,000 finished their novels and all of
them used our site and our community to
do so
on November 1st we get inundated with
hundreds of thousands of user sessions
on the order of a 100 times our average
traffic in the 12-hour period it
increases that much we couldn't possibly
host the infrastructure ourselves to
manage this kind of web traffic and in
fact every single year on November 1st
the site crashed and was down for
several hours and this was considered
kind of a a badge of honor for our
participants uh they like the fact that
the site crashed the first year we used
Amazon web services was
2012 and um the site didn't crash we use
a number of services on AWS we use the
ec2 of course running between 40 and 100
instances depending on where our traffic
load is we use RDS service for databases
mostly my SQL S3 of course um and we
also use the Route 53 service to manage
all our demands and
subdomains we have found a sweet spot in
terms of how we manage this
infrastructure with AWS by using
reserved instances which are much
cheaper by pre- reserving them than the
spot instances are one of the things I
love about AWS is how it's all
integrated and I can instantly see sort
of the status of everything we've got
and instantly navigate between these
various services to understand how they
all fit together which is very cool
using AWS first and foremost has enabled
us to achieve 100% uptime we're not
crashing anymore this is a good thing
and AWS has enabled us to refocus our
attention on our community and away from
the technology which has made us much
more effective and broadens our reach
